Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data storage, including capacity, scalability, and access patterns. Identify the applications and services that will use Azure Table Storage.
Design the storage architecture, including partitioning strategies, table schema, and integration with existing systems.
Provision a new Azure Storage Account in the Azure portal or using Azure CLI/PowerShell. Ensure the account is configured for Table Storage.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) and shared access signatures (SAS) to secure access to the storage account and tables.
Enable encryption for data at rest and in transit. Configure customer-managed keys if required.
Create tables within the Azure Storage Account using the Azure portal, Azure CLI, or SDKs. Define table schemas and partition keys.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Storage Analytics. Configure alerts for storage capacity, performance metrics, and access patterns.
Perform testing to validate storage performance, including read/write operations, latency, and scalability under load.
Set up backup and recovery mechanisms for Azure Table Storage. Configure periodic backups and test recovery procedures.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Ensure the documentation is accessible to the operations team.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure Table Storage.
Ensure the storage setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
